comments.content: I used to be the first, but as I grew older, I became the second.
my mom is first one ("YAY!!! SNOWBALLS!!! SNOW ANGELS!!! SNOWMEN!!! SLEDDING!!! ICESKATING!!!") i am the 2nd (i will leave my house when the universe starts behaving again)
I think the second doesn't want to go cause he's not keen on being seen out with that coat and boots on damaging his street cred.

OMG, that little dog is sooo Marco. He looks out the door and sees the snow and I practically have to drag  him outside. He will pee and head back towards the house and will actually not poo for a day if it means he can get out of the snow faster.  That face when you ask if he wants to play in the snow. LOL
I love the snow, so I'm definitely dog #1. Except, last winter I slipped on the ice and busted my ass. So, I think I'm gradually and unintentionally transforming into dog #2.
Kate Plakina   Fritz Helder   Sheldon McIntosh  you know my African black ass is not even represented in this example! I'm the dog staring out the window  üòÇ

Evelyn Rivera  the second dog is like Bella Ami!!!  She is a fair weather girl. If weather is good, she's out there. If there's a drop of rain......no way!!  She will drag her paws no matter what you do. What a princess!!
Anyone that knows me, knows which one i am lol.  Audrey: "My toes are numb." ... See More

As a child, I was the first dog  üê∂ , my brother, Ron, and I would play in the snow  ‚ùÑÔ∏è   ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è   ‚òÉÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚òÉÔ∏è and go sledding.  It was fun to shovel snow off our driveway & sidewalks.  Mom would fix hot cocoa for us.  üòä . As I got older, I started disliking  ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è  and after getting married  üë∞üèº  and living in the country, I disliked it even more, due to blowing and drifting!!!!  So now I am like the second dog  üê∂ !!!
OMG. Am laughing so hard. My response is dependant on the combo of freezing rain/snow combo.  Fine- my car is not equipped with ice skates - I'll stay home.

I was afraid no one would find my body until June 2017! üò± üíÉüèª üé∂

I am like a previous poster - when I was young it was great going out without a coat and no gloves throwing snowballs until my hands were blue. Then as I got older I felt the cold more easily. Now its gloves woolly pully and thick coat before sticking my head out the door!

So true! I'm the second one! And so is my chihuahua! She HATES the snow! If it's coming down hard she won't even go outside until my husband clears a path for her! Even then she has to be carried out to go and carried back in! A real Princess!

Yes that is definitely me the second one. I have spikes on my boots and I just ordered a winter walking stick from amazon lol
I'm probably the second. I hate it when its too cold, not as much as when its too hot. But Autumn is my favorite season, followed by spring. We don't even really need winter or summer  üòÇ üòÇ

I remember putting boots on two of my dog.  I would get one finished and start the second .  By the time I was done,the first dog had to be shoed again.  I let them go play and when I got them inside I realized several boots were missing and so I had to go out and find the boot. The dog I have now loves snow and catching snowflakes on his tongue.  He's a happy boy!
